titleStmt.title: James the Second, by the grace of God, King of England, Scotland, France and Ireland, Defender of the faith, &c. ... Whereas by our letters patents, bearing date the fifth day of March, in the second year of our reign, we were pleased to signifie our royal pleasure, to all our loving subjects, on the behalf of the distressed French Protestants, ...
Proclamations. 1688-01-31
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)

titleStmt.title: James the Second, by the grace of God, King of England, Scotland, France and Ireland, Defender of the faith, &c. ... Whereas by our letters patents, bearing date the fifth day of March, in the second year of our reign, we were pleased to signifie our royal pleasure, to all our loving subjects, on the behalf of the distressed French Protestants, ...
Proclamations. 1688-01-31
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)

publicationStmt.publisher: In the Savoy: printed by Thomas Newcomb, one of His Majesties printers,

notesStmt.note: Title from opening words of text.
"Witness our self at Westminster, the one and thirtieth day of January, in the third year of our reign."
"Brief for a collection for French Protestants"--Steele.
Steele notation: Ireland, Whereas whole; Arms 107.
Reproduction of the original in the Guildhall Library.

person.persName: Thomas Newcomb, one of His Majesties printers
